data.title: THE GAMER
data.statement:
You are playing a ranked game, and as usual you are going to spend all night to climb the ladder. The goal is to output your new rank after the session.

All the Ranks in order :
	• Wood    (2,1)
	• Bronze  (3,2,1)
	• Silver  (3,2,1)
	• Gold    (3,2,1)
	• Legend
The lowest rank is Wood 2, then Wood 1, Bronze 3, Bronze 2, ... , Gold 1, and Legend is the highest rank.

Your current rank and points are formatted like so, separated by a comma:
Example:
► {{Wood 1,80}}
{{Wood 1}} is the name of your rank
{{80}} is the number of points you have

Your rank increases when you have >= 100 points.
Example:
► 95 + 10 = 105. Your rank increases, and you now have 5 points, because (95 + 10) - 100 = 5

Your rank decreases when you have < 0 points.
Example:
► 5 - 10 = -5. Your rank decreases, and you now have 95 points, because 100 + (5 - 10) = 95


/!\ When your rank is Legend, your points can increase infinitely but no further rank promotion will be available.
/!\ When your rank is Wood 2, your points will never become negative. The minimum points you can have is 0.
data.stubGenerator:
read currentRank:string(256) 
read n:int
loop n read p:int


write NEW RANK
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string [[current_rank]] for your current rank and your current points, separated by a comma

<<Line 2:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of games you will be playing tonight

<<Next [[N]] lines:>> An integer [[P]] for the points you <<win>> or <<lose>> after each game
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A string for your new rank and your new points, separated by a comma

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are playing a ranked game, and as usual you are going to spend all night to climb the ladder. The goal is to output your new rank after the session.

All the Ranks in order :
• Wood (2,1)
• Bronze (3,2,1)
• Silver (3,2,1)
• Gold (3,2,1)
• Legend
The lowest rank is Wood 2, then Wood 1, Bronze 3, Bronze 2, ... , Gold 1, and Legend is the highest rank.

Your current rank and points are formatted like so, separated by a comma:
Example:
► Wood 1,80
Wood 1 is the name of your rank
80 is the number of points you have

Your rank increases when you have >= 100 points.
Example:
► 95 + 10 = 105. Your rank increases, and you now have 5 points, because (95 + 10) - 100 = 5

Your rank decreases when you have < 0 points.
Example:
► 5 - 10 = -5. Your rank decreases, and you now have 95 points, because 100 + (5 - 10) = 95


/!\ When your rank is Legend, your points can increase infinitely but no further rank promotion will be available.
/!\ When your rank is Wood 2, your points will never become negative. The minimum points you can have is 0.
Input
Line 1: A string current_rank for your current rank and your current points, separated by a comma

Line 2: An integer N for the number of games you will be playing tonight

Next N lines: An integer P for the points you win or lose after each game
Output
Line 1: A string for your new rank and your new points, separated by a comma
Constraints
1 <= N <= 50
-100 <= P <= 100
Example
Input
Silver 3,87
2
31
-11
Output
Silver 2,7
